alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Jefferson; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:26PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central St. Bernard, northwestern St. Charles, southwestern Orleans and northwestern Jefferson Parishes through 515 PM CDT... At 425 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of New Orleans to 10 miles northeast of Laplace. Movement was south-southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. This is from the outflow of a thunderstorm moving over the lake. Observations have reached 46 MPH along the lakefront of Orleans Parish. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Metairie, Hahnville, East New Orleans, Avondale, Harvey, Laplace, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Montz, River Ridge, Ama, Destrehan, St. Rose, Killona, Norco and Elmwood. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 214 and 248. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Jefferson; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
